source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant pubescent; bracts subtending flower heads leafy, pinnate, 5–22 mm long
Plant glabrous or sparsely pubescent; bracts subtending flower heads minute or absent
Flowers white or pink; pod straight or slightly curved, quite constricted between articles
Flowers yellow; pod strongly curved, hardly constricted between articles
Stems usually branched at base only; calyx teeth about half as long as tube; corolla 3–5 mm long
Stems usually branched high up; calyx teeth slightly shorter than or as long as tube; corolla 6–9 mm long
